data.title: Family of eight just dropped in for dinner.
data.text: Sunday evening our party of eight dropped in and we were seated immediately. Our server quickly took drink orders as we visited and checked the menu. Good sized portions cooked per our requests. I even ordered soup at last minute and they got it out in time!  Really had excellent, attentive server.

data.title: Just OK
data.text: My family dined on the occasion of my aunt's birthday.  We were 10 for dinner.  The service was fine, quick and efficient at taking and serving our orders.  The food was very average.  I ordered a small prime rib with broccoli.  The meat, though tender, looked unappetizing on the plate. The broccoli had a sterile smell to it.  My husband had steak frites.  I think the Parmesan garlic fries were the best part of the meal.  The decor is very nice, western, and the restaurant has an upscale vibe to it.  Such a shame that a steakhouse couldn't serve up better quality meat.

data.title: Inconsistent food
data.text: While this restaurant has an extensive menu, there is no constant in the quality of the Steaks.  Other than the Filet, which is always good, their other steaks are hit or miss.  They are either very good, or very gristly.  They obviously need to pay better attention to where they source their meat.  Stick to the Filet Mignon, it is always good.

data.title: Disastrous dinner with friends
data.text:
We met friends for a casual dinner 
Should have left after opening the door and bring put off by the awful smell!
Our server Kiron was a lively friendly man
Took our drinks order and returned with it promptly 
Then he took our dinner order 
1 grilled chicken and strawberry salad 
1 Caesar salad no croutons , sirloin ( medium )steak , mushrooms and onion with mash 
1 Caesar with croutons , talaria and grilled shrimp , broccoli, mash 
1 Caesar dressing on the side 
Medium Fillet mushroom and onion and broccoli 
He repeated the order once take and got it right 
After a long wait ( restaurant was almost empty ) the 3 salads arrived
Then hot bread and butter
And almost immediately the hot meals 
My husband's sirloin had been forgotten and arrived when everyone had finished their meals( meat was almost well done 
My friends mushrooms were without onions 
Felt sorry for server but kitchen got it all wrong .He thanked us for our patience 
At no time did a manager come near us to see how things were going 
We will not be back

data.title: The filet was not a filet
data.text: Three of us arrived at 5:10 for dinner. We had tickets to a 7 PM movie at a theater 5 minutes away. The restaurant was fairly empty. Service was very slow. I ordered a 6 oz. filet  medium rare with sauteed mushrooms and mashed potatoes. The texture of the filet was like none I've ever had before. It was more like a thick but cheap sirloin, over-cooked. The mushrooms were tasteless, like they had been sauteed in water. Also the sizes were not uniform. Some whole, some sliced white button mushrooms. Some were hard, some were slimy. The mashed potatoes were fine. Since I'd only eaten half my meal, I ordered dessert. Cinnamon apple pie thingy with ice cream. It tasted like freezer to oven to table. Too much tough crust. Too many under-cooked apples. The ice cream was good. It took forever to bring each course and our check and our bill to sign after we'd given them our credit card. By the time we left it was 7 PM. Thank goodness the movie showed previews! I will NEVER go back. The workers were more interested in watching the AFC championship than cooking and serving my meal. They were all standing in front of the TV in the dining room.

data.title: Good Food, Good Service
data.text: Great evening at Longhorn.  The entrees were great with plentiful portions.  The staff worked well in a great team effort from the hostess to food service.  The atmosphere for early dinner was quiet enough for easy conversation.

data.title: Great dessert
data.text: This place has a chocolate cake that is loaded with all the right things. This dessert , deserves to be on your bucket list!

data.title: Good food.
data.text:
I love the longhorn steakhouse, the waitress was very nice and polite
The t-bone was very good. 
The price is good for what you get.

data.title: Chain Restaurant Fare
data.text: The food and service quality we were use to at the Toco Hills location cannot be found in any of the other local restaurants.  The food is okay, but the service is not in the ballpark with Toco Hills.  Management needs to lead!!!!    Drink refills? How's the steak cooked? Glad you are here?

data.title: Mediocre food
data.text:
Have been there with friends who seem to like this restaurant 
Menu limited if you don't eat meat and gluten . Orders sometimes come out incorrect 
Don't like the feeling of the restaurant to noisesy

data.title: Great food and Wonderful service
data.text: If are in the mood for some yummy shrimp,chicken or steak I highly recommend you stop byLonghorns Steakhouse. I ordered the crusted parmasean chicken and it was delicious. Everything was wonderful. Our server Zane was fantastic! Next time we go back I would request her. They have somthing for everyone. Definetly recommend you check it out no matter what you crave.

data.title: Not the best
data.text: Had occasion to stop in for a quick dinner in this Sandy Springs location.  Food was just ok.  Not likely to return.

data.title: Considerably Short on Quality!!
data.text: This specific location has been opened for twenty years plus!  First, quality has been both up and down.  Portion sizes, are that of Outback...small to mid!! The Spinach Dip was served cold!! One Porterhouse entree; served overcooked.  The second entree, had hair on the plate; in which server did not notice this visual screw up!! Once again, lack of quality control!

data.title: Always good
data.text: You just can't go wrong here when the service is good. Steaks were cooked perfect for the whole group. Didn't have time to finish the first drink before they were bringing fresh ones.

data.title: Poor service
data.text: Called here on July 10th 2014. Party of 5 got seated fairly quickly and drinks order taken including water. Water arrived soon after along with two sets of cutlery but no drinks. Over ten minutes later " drinks are on the way". My son in laws drink had been sitting so long that the ice had dissolved and the drink was just water. My daughter's drink couldn't be fulfilled until the third selection. Steaks all round, mine was to be med rare my daughter a med. when they eventually arrived,,, wrong way round. "Can I fix that for you",,, well you can't uncook it. By this stage I was so hungry that I just said forget it. All this time we were met with "everything ok",, evidentally things were not computing, so the tip was reflected with the check. Ps I usually tip well.

data.title: A good choice when you are at the Atlanta airport
data.text: I was surprised to see a Longhorn restaurant in an airport but decided to try it. Seating is tight, especially with everyone having suitcases, but the staff is one of the best I've experienced.  They are extremely competent and responsive to your requests and the food is served quickly.  The menu is limited to a few choices from the standard Longhorn menu but you can usually find a favorite among the items.  I did have to ask for bread -it was not automatically served.  The salad was fresh and the food was hot and tasty.  If you happen to be in the Atlanta airport and have time for lunch, I suggest you try it.

data.title: Great airport food if you've got time to spare
data.text: We went to this place for dinner and had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated as it was a pretty busy time. The food was great! Everyone in our group loved their food. However our service was pretty bad and the waitress only had about 4 tables. We had issues from the beginning with getting orders correct and it took us almost 45 minutes for our bill after telling her we'd like to pay. The steak was great that I had and I enjoyed the onion pedals. Alcohol is pricey.

data.title: Loud and Good
data.text: Longhorns serves a great steak and seldom lets you down. Again the steak was seasoned and cooked just right. Lisa was our server and did an excellent job. Place is loud as families gather to get good food and have fun.

data.title: Looking for BBQ
data.text: A friend recommended that I seek out some BBQ  on my trip to Atlanta.  My only opportunity, however was on my way out of town.  I checked out the Longhorn Steakhouse at the airport, and was pleasantly surprised. I ordered a BBQ sandwich (not my usual menu choice). The beef was very tender and tasty, with a tangy, mildly hot sauce on the side. Serving size was generous. Service was prompt and friendly, even on this busy airport day. Good choice.

data.title: Excellent all around
data.text: Server was excellent as were the meals.  We were treated like we were regular customers and could not have asked for better.
